questions.question_text: The feasibility of the risk management planning is dependent upon which of the following aspects of the organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Culture, people, and infrastructure capabilities

Selected Answer: D
Ref: Section 4.2, The Standard for Risk Mgt in Portfolios, Programs and Projects

Selected Answer: D
According to Plan Risk Management Book - 4.2.3 chapter 4 , D is the best answer

Sorry, typo earlier. Answer is D*** 
Culture, People and Infrastructure
https://vceguide.com/the-feasibility-of-the-risk-management-planning-is-dependent-upon-which-of-the-following-aspects-of-the-organization/

Selected Answer: B
A Project Management Office (PMO) is a centralized team or department within an organization that standardizes and oversees project management practices.

Selected Answer: B
PMO as supporting in Project.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an effective channel for risk mitigation assistance, project risk visibility and risk escalation support?

choices.B: Add the risks to a watchlist for periodic monitoring.
choices.C: Remove the risks from the risk register.
choices.D: Conduct a low priority risk response planning workshop with key stakeholders.
choices.A: Create risk responses later, as time allows.

discussion.content: Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B. Add the risks to a watchlist for periodic monitoring.
B. Add the risks to a watchlist for periodic monitoring.
B is the right answer
B. Add the risks to a watchlist for periodic monitoring.?????

questions.question_text: The team has just completed a risk response planning session and identified responses for all the high and medium priority risks. What should the team do with the remaining low priority risks?
PESTLE, TECOP, and SPECTRUM are three examples of prompt lists that can be used during risk management activities. Prompt lists are used to do which of the following?

discussion.content: Its T & T of Risk identification so answer is A.
"STimulate risk identification" not "Simulate risk identification."

choices.B: Perform a simulation with all prompted risks varying simultaneously.
choices.C: Identify basic causes of risks of more fundamental forces.
choices.D: Achieve the relative weighting of the risks.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Risk manager, risk owners, and project sponsor

Selected Answer: D
D is corect . It is not mentioned anywhere it's an agile project .

Selected Answer: C
Tips:
- internal problem > not customer
- technical + risk > risk owner + risk manager
- customer relationships > product owner = internal + BA

Could be Project Sponsor (option D) to help with problems within the organization or at the level of procedures. If not, Option C
I don't think you can change the risk management plan without involving and getting buy in from the customer or technical relationships that have already been identified as risky.

comments.content: So, what is your suggested answer?

discussion.content: its not agile ,, D is correct
D is correct
For me is C

choices.D: Risk manager, risk owners, and project sponsor
choices.B: Project sponsor, product owner, and risk owners
choices.A: Risk manager, technical manager, and customers
choices.C: Risk manager, product owner, and risk owners

questions.question_text:
During a major project review, the project manager discovers that large groups of internal management issues are obstructing progress. In reviewing the risk management plan, the project risk categories largely contain technical and customer relationship type risks. The project manager wants the risk management plan revised to account for these risk areas, particularly because the project has several more months before completion.
Who should the project manager collaborate with to revise the risk management plan at this stage of the project?
